events.event_description: U.S. refinery utilization has decreased significantly, falling as low as 81% during two weeks in February and dropping below the five-year low.
events.citation: Since early January 2024, U.S. refinery utilization has decreased 11%, falling as low as 81% during the two weeks ending February 9 and February 16, and briefly dropped below the five-year (2019–23) low.

events.event_description: U.S. Gulf Coast refinery utilization has decreased 14% since early January, falling below 80% due to weather-related issues and planned maintenance.
events.citation: Since the first week of January, U.S. Gulf Coast four-week average refinery utilization has decreased  14%, falling below 80% for the past two weeks. The reduced refinery runs are likely the result of weather-related issues stemming from cold temperatures, as well as planned maintenance.

events.event_description: Maintenance shutdowns are occurring at Motiva Port Arthur and Marathon Galveston Bay refineries, which represent 7% of total U.S. capacity.
events.citation: Trade press indicates maintenance shutdowns are underway at the Motiva Port Arthur and Marathon Galveston Bay refineries, which together account for about 7% of total U.S. capacity, or more than one million barrels per day of processing capacity.

events.event_description: BP's Whiting refinery in Indiana experienced an unplanned outage, causing a 10% drop in Midwest regional refinery utilization.
events.citation: In the Midwest (PADD 2), bp's refinery in Whiting, Indiana, (the largest refinery in the Midwest) was taken offline because of an unplanned outage. This outage is also a major source of reduced utilization nationwide and the driving force behind a 10% drop in Midwest regional refinery utilization since the first week in January.

events.event_description: Regional retail gasoline prices increased across all regions as of March 4, while diesel prices slightly decreased in the last two weeks.
events.citation: As of Monday, March 4, regional retail gasoline prices increased in all regions compared with the previous Monday. Although similar increases occurred in mid-February, on-highway diesel prices have come down slightly in all regions in the last two weeks.
